item.title: Rayman Twitter Account Just Posted for the First Time in 4 Years
item.description:
Rayman fans have good reason to be excited, as the official Twitter account for the franchise posted a new message for the first time in four years. The message comes from some of the minds behind the Rayman series, and not only looks fondly upon the past, but also offers some hype for the future of the franchise.

Rayman kicked off in 1995, originally developed by Ubisoft Montpellier, and expanded into full-fledged franchise, with the core series receiving five games, with plenty of spin-off games, including the Raving Rabbids sub-series. Fans have appreciated the series for three decades now, but it's been a long time since the core series has received a new game, with Rayman Legends initially launching back in 2013. Now, in honor of the series' 30th anniversary, and to celebrate a fan event that was being held for the series, some of the game's developers have shared an official message about Rayman 's past and what the future holds.

Rayman Twitter Account Shares Exciting New Message

On Twitter, fans of Rayman became curious after the account changed its profile image and message. Shortly after, an official Tweet was sent out with a three minute video from the Rayman brand producer Loic Gounon, as well as composer Christophe Heral. The video was originally broadcast as part of the Rayman Alive fan event, which took place on September 1. Gounon said that "starting now," the developers would be looking back and sharing the history of the series, including behind-the-scenes segments, interviews with the developers, and concept art in the coming months.

Gounon went on to note that the next project from the classic 3D platformer game series is still in the works, stating that Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan are working together to create the next game. He noted that Rayman is in good hands, but also tempered hype, explaining that fans shouldn't expect to hear anything in the immediate future about the game. Judging from the statement, it may be several years before another Rayman game officially releases. Following this reveal, they included a segment with Christophe Heral, the composer of Rayman Origins and Rayman Legends . He expressed his gratitude for the fans' heartwarming notes to him about his music for the series, and then he held a mini-performance live for the fans.

Fans seem to be extremely enthusiastic following the release of this tweet. While it might disappoint some to learn that it will be a while before the next Rayman game, simply knowing the original series hasn't been abandoned and that the developers are passionate about it is a big positive.

item.title: Reasons Why You Should Start No Man's Sky In 2025
item.description:
What began as a controversial launch has transformed into one of the most remarkable comeback stories in gaming. Over the years, No Man’s Sky has evolved into a massive, living universe, constantly shaped by free updates and developer dedication. Today, in 2025, the game stands as richer, broader, and more polished than ever before.

With a thriving player base, major content drops, and cross-platform accessibility, there has never been a better moment to step into its galaxy. Whether the draw is survival, exploration, building, or cooperation, there is more content than ever to enjoy, and 2025 is perhaps the best time to experience No Man's Sky in all its glory.

Years Of Free Expansions

More Content Than You Could Ever Need

One of the most compelling reasons to begin playing No Man's Sky in 2025 is the wealth of free expansions that have accumulated since launch. From new biomes and improved exploration systems to base-building mechanics and multiplayer hubs, each update has broadened the scope of the universe, and entering now means immediate access to years of hard-earned content.

Instead of slowly waiting for features to arrive, new players step into a game that feels like the definitive edition of itself. Every lesson learned from past updates is woven into the present experience, making the galaxy more welcoming, stable, and endlessly rewarding to explore.

More Players Than Ever

The Highest Peak Since 2018

The community for No Man's Sky has never been larger, and that creates a far more connected experience. Random matchmaking is smoother, cooperative exploration is livelier, and community hubs are bustling with activity. The events and expeditions are supported by a vibrant player base, ensuring no corner of the universe feels empty.

For new players, this means easier access to help, trading, and group activities. Whether building bases together or tackling missions, multiplayer features benefit from the latest surge in activity, and the sheer volume of players adds life to the stars, making exploration feel less solitary and more like a true shared adventure.

Switch 2 And Crossplay Support

Exploring The Galaxy At Home And On The Go

With the release of the Nintendo Switch 2, combined with cross-platform functionality, No Man’s Sky is more accessible than ever. Friends scattered across different systems can now explore the galaxy together seamlessly, which removes barriers that once divided the player base, creating one unified universe.

Cross-platform play ensures that new players can immediately connect with others regardless of hardware, and also allows players to carry their progression between platforms. For those looking to jump in now, the ability to explore with anyone, anywhere, makes 2025 a uniquely inclusive and social time to start the journey.

Enhanced Visuals And Performance

Looks As Good As It Runs

Over the years, updates have significantly overhauled No Man's Sky's visuals, making the game look sharper and more immersive than ever before. Improved lighting, water rendering, and terrain generation create a universe that feels alive and dynamic, with planets brimming with detail, and environmental variety that makes exploration rewarding at every step.

Also, performance improvements have been a focus, ensuring smoother framerates and faster loading across all platforms. Combined, these changes make the universe not only more beautiful but more comfortable to explore, and right now, the game encompasses the best balance of artistry, technical stability, and immersive exploration it's ever seen.

Voyagers/Worlds Part 2 Updates

Huge Content Additions, From Ships To Stars

In 2025, the Worlds 2 and Voyagers expansions have reshaped the galaxy in dramatic ways. Worlds 2 introduces billions of new stars and improved planetary biomes, while Voyagers added massive corvette-class starships that act as mobile bases that can be piloted with other players onboard.

These updates breathe new life into exploration and progression, as players now have more reasons than ever to travel, build, and discover the universe. While there have been plenty of other updates over the years, these larger examples represent major changes to how the game can be experienced, so jumping in with the content already in place ensures there is always more to discover without having to wait for new updates to roll out.

The Price

It Just Keeps Going Down

No Man’s Sky remains one of the best value purchases in gaming, and that value is continuing to grow every year with more content and a price that keeps creeping down with every sale. With no subscription required and years of content included at no extra charge, the sheer amount of exploration, building, and multiplayer activities available is remarkable given the acquisition cost.

Compared to many live-service games, No Man's Sky continues to deliver expansions without charging additional fees. That model ensures newcomers are never left behind or priced out of major features, and allows players to buy now and receive a vast, mature game at a fraction of what it might have cost in the past.

Future Update Promises

Support That Will Continue For Years To Come

No Man's Sky's history shows a clear commitment to ongoing growth. Hello Games has continually released expansions that redefine what the experience can be. This track record gives players confidence that the universe will continue to evolve, with fresh mechanics and features on the horizon, and promises that support will persist into future years and beyond.

Starting in 2025 does not just mean enjoying the current state of the game, but stepping into a living project that continues to surprise. The sense of discovery extends beyond the stars to the game itself, as each update brings new reasons to return, making it a long-term investment that is guaranteed to pay off.

Modding Community

Tailoring The Journey To Your Own Tastes

Beyond official expansions, No Man’s Sky benefits from a thriving modding community, particularly on PC. These mods range from graphical improvements and interface tweaks to ambitious overhauls that reshape how the game is played, ensuring nearly limitless customization.

For new players, mods offer a chance to tailor the universe to personal taste. Whether it means enhancing the visuals, streamlining the mechanics, or experimenting with entirely new concepts, modding adds another layer of depth that allows an already expansive game to remain endlessly adaptable for years to come.

item.title: No Man's Sky Players Are Building the Millennium Falcon, Pirate Ships, Tower of Sauron, and More
item.description:
Following the recent Voyagers update, No Man’s Sky players have shown off some incredible ship designs. Using the new building tools, No Man's Sky players have created custom Corvette-class starships based on popular media franchises, such as Star Wars and The Lord of the Rings .

While No Man’s Sky is over nine years old, Hello Games continues to release new free updates. In addition to squashing bugs, they often bring new content to the open-world survival game. Recently, the developer released the Voyagers update, which expanded on the game’s already robust building systems. Specifically, players can now create custom Corvette-class starships in No Man's Sky , using various parts. Unsurprisingly, the No Man’s Sky community has shared many eye-catching designs.

No Man's Sky Players Share Incredible Ship Designs

On the official No Man’s Sky subreddit, many gamers have posted unique starship designs made possible by the Voyagers update. Thanks to the new building system, players have had the chance to flex their creative muscles, coming up with some impressive results. For example, Reddit user AcoupleofIrishfolk used various ship parts and decorations to recreate Barad-dur, complete with the iconic eye. Beyond that, players like Muhdgo, Johnnyoneshot, and ImMatuR, shared screenshots of pirate ship-themed builds. Each player came up with creative ways to incorporate sails and a deck layout.

​

Another player, known as Sm1lerXD, took inspiration from Star Wars for their Corvette-class custom starship. While one player had built a No Man’s Sky base based on the Millennium Falcon, the recent update made creating a ship version of the iconic vessel possible. As seen in the images, the player nailed the classic design, and they even created a mini version, which was shared in the comments. A couple of other impressive designs shared so far include a Necron Cairn-class Tomb ship by Thi5_Guy and one built by CaptainsBoat that resembled a bee.

​It will be interesting to see what other ingenious designs are shared with the community in the weeks ahead. It is worth noting that the Voyagers update was released on August 27, meaning players have had only a few days to experience the new modular building system. As the many gamers who are playing No Man's Sky get more acquainted with the new feature, more impressive creations will likely be shared.

Beyond ship building, the Voyagers update introduced other content. For instance, players can now get a new Exosuit and Jetpack. Hello Games has also fixed more bugs to help ensure a stable gameplay experience. With all of these changes, it could be a good time to jump back into the game.

Lose yourself in a vast sci-fi odyssey as you explore a near-infinite, procedurally generated universe. Set out from the edge of the Euclid galaxy and carve out your own interstellar existence in a vast universe teeming with life, danger and near-endless mystery. No Man's Sky is a hugely-ambitious, heavily-stylised, sci-fi adventure that spans entire galaxies all brought to life with procedural generation. Travel through an endless array of increasingly diverse and dangerous star systems, prospecting for rare materials, trading with alien life, populate planets and searching for clues to the meaning of the universe's mysterious existence. How you survive is up to you. Assemble entire fleets of dreadnought-class freighters and tear across the universe; build sprawling habitable bases across planet surfaces, beneath the ground or under the ocean; buy and upgrade your own weapons and star ships and do battle with outlaw space pirates, hostile alien fauna or the mysterious sentinel fleets. The universe is yours to explore - trillions upon trillions of planets, waiting to be discovered.

item.title: Roblox: Build A Boat For Treasure Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Codes For Build A Boat For Treasure
  • How to Redeem Codes in Build a Boat For Treasure
  • How to Play Build A Boat For Treasure
  • Best Roblox Adventure Games Like Build A Boat For Treasure
  • About the Build A Boat For Treasure Developers

Build A Boat For Treasure has gained popularity on Roblox because of its fantastic concept, where players first have to build a boat and then test it on an obstacle course. It can often be quite challenging for Roblox players to make a good boat in the early stages of the game, which is where the Build A Boat For Treasure codes listed below can come in handy.

Updated September 1, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are several codes active right now, each one giving you a small but handy boost. Some provide gold, while others unlock items like fireworks or building materials that can help you out. Since they can be claimed quickly, it’s worth grabbing them while they last. We’ll continue updating this guide so you can always check back for new rewards.

All Codes For Build A Boat For Treasure

Roblox players looking to get some extra gold, blocks, and other building materials for creating a beautiful boat can use the following active codes.

These codes will expire at random intervals, so be sure to redeem them as soon as they become available. Codes can only be redeemed once per account. Be sure to check back frequently, as codes can be released anytime during the month.

Working Build A Boat For Treasure Codes

  • hi - Redeem for 5 Gold
  • Squid Army - Redeem for 22x Ice and 22x Gold
  • =D - Redeem for 5 Gold
  • =P - Redeem for 5 Gold
  • chillthrill709 was here - Redeem for a Firework

Expired Build A Boat For Treasure Codes

  • Happy Valentine's day - Redeem for free blocks
  • Be a big f00t print - Redeem for free blocks
  • fuzzy friend? - Redeem for free blocks
  • Lurking Legend - Redeem for free blocks
  • GGGOOOAAALLL - Redeem for a Football
  • Free gifts - Redeem for a bunch of free gifts!
  • 1B - Redeem for free blocks!
  • voted code - Redeem for free blocks!
  • Lurking Code - Redeem for 10x Balloons, 5x Super Fireworks, 1x Portal Block!
  • 1M Likes - Redeem for free blocks!
  • Big F00t Print - Redeem for 10x Balloons, 5x Cake, 25x Neon Blocks!
  • The Sasquatch? - Redeem for 10x Balloons, 5x Circle Fireworks, 1x Portal Block!
  • Fireworks - Redeem for free blocks!
  • 2M members - Redeem for free Blocks!
  • Hatched code - Redeem for Cookie Wheels!
  • Happy Easter - Redeem for Balloons, Candy, & Cake!
  • TTTRRREEEAAASSSUUURRREEE - Redeem for a Green Treasure Chest!
  • BBBOOOAAATTTSSS!!! - Redeem for 1x Boat Motor, 1x Car Seat, 4x Wood Block, 1x Cake!
  • The Yeti - Redeem for 25x Green Presents, 25x Neon Blocks!
  • Cold Feet - Redeem for 25x Green Presents, 25x Neon Blocks!
  • 500M Visits - Redeem for 4x Portal, 5x Cake, 25x Balloons, 20x Star Blocks!
  • Veterans Day - Redeem for 10x Banners, 10x Star Blocks, 10x Balloons, 5x Circle Fireworks, 5x Cluster Fireworks, 5x Super Fireworks!

How to Redeem Codes in Build a Boat For Treasure

To redeem codes in Build A Boat For Treasure, players will simply need to follow the steps outlined below. If a code does not work, they should be sure to check that it was entered correctly. Assuming it was, it may mean that the code has recently expired or has already been redeemed.

  1. Launch Build A Boat For Treasure
  2. Press the treasure icon located to the right of the screen
  3. Once the pop-up menu opens up, select the gear icon at the top right
  4. Paste the code into the field
  5. Press Redeem to collect the rewards

How to Play Build A Boat For Treasure

Build A Boat For Treasure is a game in which players need to make their own boat and sail as far as possible. First, players need to go to a special area where they can build and then select the tool in the second inventory slot. A menu of resources will appear there, and at first, there will be a few of them.

After the players have built their boat and placed a chair, they should sit in it and press launch. After that, players have to swim as far as possible through the obstacles. They need to be very careful because the boat can be destroyed. After reaching a certain distance, players will receive rewards and can then repeat the process.

Best Roblox Adventure Games Like Build A Boat For Treasure

There are many games similar to Build A Boat For Treasure. Below, players will find a list of the top five games like Build A Boat For Treasure :

  • Anime Adventures
  • Your Bizarre Adventure
  • Dragon Adventures
  • Boat Ride into a Better Life
  • Build a Boat or Die

About the Build A Boat For Treasure Developers

The team of developers, named Chillz Studios, who created Build A Boat For Treasure in 2016, has a lot of experience in creating games. Here is a list of other Roblox games from Chillz Studios that were popular before:

  • REVENGE OF THE SLIMES!!!
  • Mr. Cube The Boss Battle!
  • Marble Maker
  • Build and Burn

item.title: Video Game Monthly Subscriptions With The Most Games, Ranked
item.description:
Subscription services have reshaped the way games are played, offering access to massive libraries in exchange for a monthly fee. Instead of purchasing individual titles, players can explore hundreds of options across genres, from blockbuster releases to niche indie gems. Yet not all services are equal in scope or variety.

Some prioritize quantity, others emphasize curation, and a few offer limited selections with unique appeal. For those wondering where to invest their time and money, knowing which video game subscription services offer the best bang for their buck is an important part of the decision-making process, and there are quite a few that stand out in terms of overall value purely from a numbers standpoint.

PS Plus Essential

A Nice Bonus Every Single Month

At the most basic tier of PlayStation’s subscription service, PS Plus Essential offers a modest monthly selection of free titles alongside access to multiplayer content. Typically, this amounts to three to five games, with choices spanning big-budget hits, indie standouts, or multiplayer staples.

The strength of Essential lies in variety over sheer quantity. It provides just enough rotation to keep members engaged while ensuring quality selections, but with no permanent back catalog included, the offering feels more like a bonus than a comprehensive library.

Xbox Game Pass Core

Classics And New Games Alike

Formerly known as Xbox Live Gold, Xbox Game Pass Core focuses primarily on online multiplayer access, but it also provides a small selection of around 25 games for players to enjoy. The library is curated to highlight popular titles across genres, offering reliable staples like Halo, Forza, and other Microsoft-published hits.

Compared to higher tiers, though, the scope is undeniably limited, and it best suits players who value online connectivity over wanting a small library. It offers strong value for casual players or those who only dip into gaming occasionally, but still has more than enough to offer, no matter what genre the player is into.

Ubisoft+

The RPG Lover's Ideal Service

Ubisoft+ takes a focused approach, providing access to an extensive list from the publisher's catalog, ranging from blockbuster franchises like Assassin’s Creed , Far Cry, and Watch Dogs , to smaller releases like The Rogue Prince of Persia . While the library is not as varied as some services, the sheer volume of Ubisoft titles on offer ensures a hefty collection for fans of open-world adventures and whimsical tales.

The service’s appeal lies in consistency, as new releases are immediately available without any extra cost. However, those uninterested in Ubisoft’s formula may find the selection repetitive. It is an excellent option for loyal fans, but as a broader gaming library, its range is fairly narrow.

EA Play

From Sports To Full-Blown Shooters

EA Play offers a sizable back catalog anchored by sports titles, racing games, and action franchises. Annual hits like FIFA , Madden , and NHL are the primary draw, alongside classics such as Mass Effect and Dragon Age , with the library constantly being expanded with sequels and new releases alike.

One of EA Play’s biggest strengths is trial access, allowing players to test upcoming titles for limited hours before release. While it lacks the variety of multi-publisher services, it provides strong value for those invested in EA’s flagship franchises.

Apple Arcade

Gaming On The Go

Apple Arcade emphasizes curation over quantity, offering hundreds of ad-free mobile and indie titles across iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple TV. Its library is notable for creativity, spotlighting experimental games, family-friendly adventures, and artistic projects often overlooked elsewhere.

The service also removes the clutter of in-app purchases and ads, making it an attractive option for parents and casual players. It delivers breadth and variety not through sheer numbers, but through consistent quality and a clean, distraction-free ecosystem.

Nintendo Switch Online

Returning To A Different Time

Nintendo’s subscription service offers a pretty large and nostalgic catalog, including classic NES, SNES, Nintendo 64, and Game Boy titles. The Expansion Pack adds even more games from a wider range of consoles, allowing players to dive into the past while playing on a modern piece of hardware.

The appeal of Nintendo Switch Online is strongest for players invested in Nintendo’s history. Each update expands the classic library further, preserving legendary titles for new generations and allowing older players to return to a simpler time.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate

Brand New Releases And A Library Of Icons

Xbox Game Pass is one of the best value services out there, featuring day-one releases for some of gaming's most anticipated titles, along with hundreds of games spanning first-party exclusives and smaller indie releases across a range of publishers and genres.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate enhances the offering with cloud gaming and cross-platform play, making the service accessible across consoles, PCs, and mobile devices. Its library grows monthly, constantly refreshing with new releases and surprise additions, and with extra bonuses like access to the EA Play library at no extra cost, it is hard to match the value for money.

PS Plus Extra/Premium

A Huge Catalog That Grows Every Single Day

PlayStation Plus' higher tiers boast a massive catalog that stands at the top of the subscription service leaderboard. PS Plus Extra includes hundreds of modern titles spanning countless genres, from Spider-Man: Miles Morales to indie standouts, and the Premium tier adds a layer with access to a rotating selection of classic PlayStation titles as well.

This service offers an impressive breadth of experiences, from cinematic blockbusters to overlooked gems. The extensive library makes it one of the most generous subscriptions available, offering so much volume and variety while still including new releases to keep players up to date at all times.
